The Texas legislator: Lon Burnam, compared the diversity of governmental representation in Russia and Texas, stating that Russia has more diversity.
The expert researched election results i: indicating a level of diversity in representation.
The breakdown of the 2011 election resul: the party of Russia President Dmitriy Medvedev, received the highest percentage of votes (49%), followed by the Communist Party (19%), Fair Russia (14%), and the Liberal Democrats (12%).
Four parties ultimately landed seats in: with United Russia gaining 238 seats (53%), the Communist Party winning 92 seats (20%), Fair Russia securing 64 seats (14%), and the Liberal Democrats obtaining 5 seats.
